I'm the master of this fine {academy}, giving {lessons} to my students.
My name is Seymour, but to you I am 'Sir' Seymour.
The academy is the building you are standing in. We have a {library}, a {training} centre, a {bank} and the room of the {oracle}.
Oh, which lesson did you want to attend again? Was it {Rookgaard}, {fighting}, {equipment}, {citizens}, the {academy} or the {oracle}?
There are many books in the bookcases around you, unless some naughty kids stole them again. Read them for more and detailed information.
When you have the time, please visit our training centre downstairs. 'Look' at the blackboards to read some import antadvice. Oh, you need a {key} for that!
In a bank you can deposit your earned gold coins safely.
The oracle is a mysterious being just upstairs. It will bring you to the {Pont Vanis} or {Nilfgaard} to choose your {vocation} once youare level 10.
Rookgaard is the name of this {village} as well as of the whole {island}. It belongs to the kingdom of {Pont Vanis}, in our world which iscalled {Tibia}.
You have to fight {monsters} to train your {skills} and {level}. If you lose {health}, eat {food} to regain it or use a {potion}.
Don't go hunting without proper equipment. You need at least a suitable {weapon}, {armor}, {shield}, {rope} and {shovel}. A {torch} isalso good as well as {legs}, a {helmet} and {shoes}.
Most of the citizens here are {merchants}. You can give me the name of any non-player character and I will tell you something about him or her.
Yes, depositing your money will keep it safe, so it is a good idea to store it in the bank. Of course, you can always withdraw it again.
There are four vocations: {knights}, {paladins}, {sorcerers} and {druids}. You can choose your vocation once you are level 10 and have talked to the oracle.
The most important places in this village are the {temple}, the different {shops}, the {academy} and the {bridges}.
The world of Norah is very large with tons of places to explore. Vast deserts, Caribbean islands, deep jungles, greenmeadows and jagged mountains await you!
Good monsters to start hunting are {rats}. They live in the {sewers} below the village.
The more you fight with a weapon, the better will be your skill handling this weapon. Don't worry about that right nowthough, this will become important once you have a vocation.
Once you gained enough experience for a level, you will advance. This means - among other things - more {health} points, afaster walking speed and more strength to carry things.
Your current health is shown by the red bar on the right side. Death awaits you if it goes down to zero.
Use a small health potion in case of emergencies to fill up around 75 health points. She alsohas {antidote} potions.
The starter weapon, a club, won't get you far. You should earn some {money} and buy a better weapon such as a sabre from {Obi's} shop. Simply ask for a {trade}.
The starter armor, a coat, does not protect you well. First of all, earn some money and try to get a sturdy leather armorfrom {Dixi's} shop. Simply ask for a {trade}.
I fear you have to buy your first shield by yourself. A wooden shield from {Dixi} is a good choice.
You definitely need a rope to progress in dungeons, else you might end up stuck. Buy one from {Al Dee}.
A shovel is needed to dig some {dungeon} entrances open. 'Use' it on a loose stone pile to make a hole large enough to enter.
A torch will provide you with light in dark {dungeons}. 'Use' it to light it. You can buy them from {Al Dee}.
Leather legs might be a good basic protection. You can buy them from {Dixi}. Or, once you are strong enough,hunt {trolls}. They sometimes carry them in their {loot}.
A sturdy leather helmet is a good choice for a beginner. You can either buy it from {Dixi}, or, once you arestrong enough, {loot} them from {trolls}.
Leather boots are basic shoes which will protect you well. You can either buy them from {Dixi}, or, once you arestrong enough, {loot} them from {trolls}.
Merchants buy and sell goods. Just ask them for a {trade} to see what they offer or buy from you.
There are four vocations: {knights}, {paladins}, {sorcerers} and {druids}. You can choose your vocation once you are level 8 and have talked to the {oracle}.
Knights are strong melee fighters. You will learn all about them once you are level 10 and reached the Island of {Destiny}.
Paladins are swift distance fighters. You will learn all about them once you are level 10 and reached the Island of {Destiny}.
Druids are nature magic users and great healers. You will learn all about them once you are level 10 and reached the Island of {Destiny}.
Sorcerers are talented elemental magicians. You will learn all about them once you are level 10 and reached the Island of {Destiny}.
The temple is the place to go when you are very low on {health} or poisoned. Ask {Norfried} for a heal - he usually notices emergencies by himself.
We have a {weapon} and an {armor} shop south of the academy. {Equipment} such as {ropes} are sold to the north-west. {Potion} scan be bought to the south. And then there are the {farms}.
There is a bridge to the north and one to the west which lead outside the village. You should only leave once you are well {equipped} and at least level 2.
Paying for your Tibia account will turn it into a premium account. This means access to more areas and functions of thegame as well as other neat features.
You should not descend into dungeons without proper {equipment}. Once you are all prepared, ask the bridge {guards} for suitable {monsters}.
To attack a rat, simply click on it in your battle list. Make sure that you have proper {equipment}, though! Also, I give you 2 gold coins for each {dead rat}.
One entrance to the sewers is south of this {academy}. Look for a sewer grate, then use it to climb down.
Some monsters poison you. To heal poison, use an antidote potion on yourself. Buy them at {Lily}'s store.
Make money buy killing {monsters} and picking up their {loot}. You can sell many of the things they carry.
Obi sells and buys {weapons}. You can find his shop south of the academy.
I personally don't have anything to trade, but you can ask {merchants} for a trade. That will open a window where you cansee their offers and the things they buy from you.
Dixi sells and buys {armors}, {shields}, {helmets} and {legs}. You can find her shop south of the academy, just go up the stairs in {Obi}'s shop.
Dixi sells and buys {armors}, {shields}, {helmets} and {legs}. You can find her shop south of the academy, just go up the stairs in {Obi}'s shop.
Al Dee has a general {equipment} store in the north-western part of the village. He sells useful stuff such as {ropes}.
Trolls are quite nasty monsters which you shouldn't face before level 3 or 4 depending on your {equipment}. Ask the bridge {guards} for their locations!
Once a monster is dead, you can select 'Open' on the {corpse} to check what's inside. Sometimes they carry {money} or other items which you can sell to {merchants}.
Hmmm, let me look at you. You got that intelligent sparkle in your eyes and you'd love to handle great power - that must bea future sorcerer!
A humble monk living in the {temple} south of here. He can heal you if you are wounded or poisoned.
You definitely need a rope to progress in dungeons, else you might end up stuck. Buy one from {Al Dee} or {Lee'Delle}.
The farms are west of here. You can buy and sell {food} there which you need to regain {health}.
Don't go hunting without proper equipment. You need at least a suitable {weapon}, {armor}, {shield}, {rope} and {shovel}. A {torch} is also good as well as {legs}, a {helmet} and {shoes}.
The guards {Dallheim} and {Zerbrus} protect our village from {monsters} trying to enter. They also mark useful {dungeon} locations on your map.
Use a small health potion in case of emergencies to fill up around 75 health points. You can buy them at {Lily}'s shop. She alsohas {antidote} potions.
The starter weapon, a club, won't get you far. You should earn some money and buy a better weapon such as a sabre from {Obi}'s or {Lee'Delle}'s shop. Simply ask for a {trade}.
